summary: This is an email exchange from March 1, 2019, between Stacie B. Harris of the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and two supervisors from the Public Corruption Unit in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The SDNY supervisors are reaching out to connect regarding the office's Epstein investigation after Harris contacted a line AUSA in their unit.

persons.name: Stacie B. Harris
persons.role: Attorney, Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: The recipient of an email from SDNY supervisors, responding to schedule a call regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: SDNY Public Corruption Unit reaches out to ODAG
events.description: Two supervisors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit email Stacie B. Harris at ODAG to introduce themselves and request a call regarding the Epstein investigation, noting Harris had previously contacted a line AUSA in their unit.

events.title: Call scheduled regarding Epstein investigation
events.description: Stacie B. Harris responds to the SDNY supervisors, proposing a phone call for later that day (around 1:30/2 p.m.) to connect regarding the Epstein matter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an active Epstein investigation as of February/March 2019.
The SDNY's Public Corruption Unit was involved in the Epstein investigation.
Stacie B. Harris from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) had previously reached out to a line Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) in the SDNY's Public Corruption Unit about Epstein.
Two supervisors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit initiated contact with Harris to formally connect on the matter.
The email exchange shows coordination between the DOJ's main office (ODAG) and a U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation.
